elements.description: Initialize Steamworks
elements.name: steam.init

elements.description: Update Steamworks. Call this from a script component.
elements.name: steam.update

elements.description: Restart Steamworks.
elements.name: steam.restart

elements.description: Finalize Steamworks.
elements.name: steam.finalize

elements.description: Takes AppID of DLC and checks if the user owns the DLC & if the DLC is installed.
elements.name: steam.apps_is_dlc_installed

elements.description: Returns the name of another user. Same rules as GetFriendPersonaState() apply as to whether or not the user knowns the name of the other user note that on first joining a lobby, chat room or game server the local user will not known the name of the other users automatically; that information will arrive asyncronously.
elements.name: steam.friends_get_friend_persona_name

elements.description: Activates game overlay to store page for app.
elements.name: steam.friends_activate_game_overlay_to_store

elements.description: Set a listener
elements.name: steam.set_listener

elements.description: Returns the CSteamID of the account currently logged into the Steam client. A CSteamID is a unique identifier for an account, and used to differentiate users in all parts of the Steamworks API.
elements.name: steam.user_get_steam_id

elements.description: Gets the Steam Level of the user, as shown on their profile.
elements.name: steam.user_get_player_steam_level

elements.description: Trading Card badges data access. If you only have one set of cards, the series will be 1. The user has can have two different badges for a series; the regular (max level 5) and the foil (max level 1).
elements.name: steam.user_get_game_badge_level

elements.description: Returns true if the Steam client current has a live connection to the Steam Servers.
elements.name: steam.user_logged_on

elements.description: Returns true if this users looks like they are behind a NAT device. Only valid once the user has connected to steam .
elements.name: steam.user_is_behind_nat

elements.description: Gets whether the users phone number is verified.
elements.name: steam.user_is_phone_verified

elements.description: Gets whether the users phone number is identifying.
elements.name: steam.user_is_phone_identifying

elements.description: Gets whether the users phone number is awaiting (re)verification.
elements.name: steam.user_is_phone_requiring_verification

elements.description: Gets whether the user has two factor enabled on their account.
elements.name: steam.user_is_two_factor_enabled

elements.description: Get user stat as an integer.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_stat_int

parameters.doc: Id of the stat to get
parameters.name: id

elements.description: Set user stat.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_set_stat_int

parameters.doc: Id of the stat to set
parameters.name: id

elements.description: Get user stat as a floating point number.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_stat_float

parameters.doc: Id of the stat to get
parameters.name: id

elements.description: Set user stat.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_set_stat_float

parameters.doc: Id of the stat to set
parameters.name: id

elements.description: Ask the server to send down this user's data and achievements for this game.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_request_current_stats

elements.description: Requests global stats data, which is available for stats marked as "aggregated". This call is asynchronous, with the results returned in GlobalStatsReceived_t. nHistoryDays specifies how many days of day-by-day history to retrieve in addition to the overall totals. The limit is 60.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_request_global_stats

elements.description: Store the current data on the server. Will get a callback when set and one callback for every new achievement  If the callback has a result of k_EResultInvalidParam, one or more stats uploaded has been rejected, either because they broke constraints or were out of date. In this case the server sends back updated values. The stats should be re-iterated to keep in sync.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_store_stats

elements.description: Reset stats.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_reset_all_stats

parameters.doc: True if achievements should be reset as well.
parameters.name: achievements

elements.description: Set achievement.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_set_achievement

elements.description: Get achievement.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_achievement

elements.description: Clear achievement.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_clear_achievement

elements.description: Used for iterating achievements. In general games should not need these functions because they should have a list of existing achievements compiled into them.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_num_achievements

elements.description: Get achievement name iAchievement in [0,GetNumAchievements)
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_achievement_name

elements.description: Get general attributes for an achievement. Accepts the following keys * "name" and "desc" for retrieving the localized achievement name and description (returned in UTF8) * "hidden" for retrieving if an achievement is hidden (returns "0" when not hidden, "1" when hidden)
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_achievement_display_attribute

elements.description: Returns the percentage of users who have achieved the specified achievement.
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_achievement_achieved_percent

elements.description: Asks the Steam back-end for a set of rows in the leaderboard. This call is asynchronous, with the result returned in a listener callback with event set to LeaderboardScoresDownloaded_t. LeaderboardScoresDownloaded_t will contain a handle to pull the results from GetDownloadedLeaderboardEntries(). You can ask for more entries than exist, and it will return as many as do exist. * k_ELeaderboardDataRequestGlobal requests rows in the leaderboard from the full table, with nRangeStart & nRangeEnd in the range [1, TotalEntries] * k_ELeaderboardDataRequestGlobalAroundUser requests rows around the current user, nRangeStart being negate e.g. DownloadLeaderboardEntries( hLeaderboard, k_ELeaderboardDataRequestGlobalAroundUser, -3, 3 ) will return 7 rows, 3 before the user, 3 after * k_ELeaderboardDataRequestFriends requests all the rows for friends of the current user
elements.name: steam.user_stats_download_leaderboard_entries

elements.description: Returns data about a single leaderboard entry
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_downloaded_leaderboard_entry

info.description: Functions and constants for interacting Steamworks
info.name: extension-steam
